FacilityName: Elbow Lake Coop Grain, NH3 Plant
LEPC: Grant County Office of Land mg

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Elbow Lake Coop Grain
109 1st Street SE    
Elbow Lake, MN 56531    

The board of directors, management, and employees of Elbow Lake Coop Grain are committed to the prevention of any accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia.  If an accidental release should occur, the facility is prepared to work with the Elbow Lake Fire Department, or other authorities, to minimize the impact of the release to people and the environment.

The primary activity is the storage of anhydrous ammonia and loading nurse tanks for delivery to the farm for application.

Anhydrous Ammonia is received, stored, and distributed for direct application for crop nutrients.

The maximum quantity stored would be 345,050 lbs. in one 26,000 and one 18,000 gallon tank.  The maximum quantity handled would be the unloading of a transport vessel containing 53,000 pounds.

The worst case scenario would be the release of the total contents of a storage tank release over ten minutes.  The maximum quantity would be 114,000 pounds representing 85 percent of the largest tank?s capacity, as limited by design standards.  

The alternate release scenario based on a two minute release from a break in a three inch transfer hose.  The distance to the endpoint in this case would be 1.14 miles.

The facility has implemented the provisions of ?Safety for the Storage and Handling of Anhydrous Ammonia, K-61-1.  We also use OSHS ?Storage and Handling of Anhydrous Ammonia? standards for training.

There have been no accidental releases in the past five years.

Elbow Lake Coop Grain has a written action plan, in accordance with OSHA 29CFR1910.111.  This is coordinated with the local authorities.
